title: Luísa Diogo | New Climate Economy | Commission on the Economy and Climate

quotes: Luísa Dias Diogo was Prime Minister of Mozambique from 2004 to 2010.
From 1999-2004 she was Minister of Planning and Finance.
She began working in Mozambique's Finance Ministry in 1980
became a department head in 1986
and in 1989 became national budget director.
joined the government as Deputy Minister of Finance in 1994.
In 2007 she was appointed Co-chair of the High Level Panel on UN Coherence in the areas of Humanitarian Aid, Development and Environment
In 2010 was appointed a Member of the High Level Panel on UN Global Sustainability.
in 2008 received the Prize for Women's Global Leadership.

organizations.name: Barclays Bank Mozambique
quotes: Chairperson of the Board of Directors of Barclays Bank Mozambique; She serves as Chairperson of the Board of Barclays Bank Mozambique S.A.

organizations.name: Eduardo Mondlane University
quotes: Luísa Diogo graduated with a BA in economics from Eduardo Mondlane University in Maputo

organizations.name: School of Oriental and African Studies, University of London
quotes: went on to obtain a Master's degree in financial economics at the School of Oriental and African Studies, University of London.

quotes: After a period working for the World Bank she joined the government as Deputy Minister of Finance in 1994.

roles.title: Prime Minister of Mozambique
quotes: Former Prime Minister of Mozambique
Luísa Dias Diogo was Prime Minister of Mozambique from 2004 to 2010.
As Prime Minister Luísa Diogo was widely recognized for her achievements in the national reconstruction and economic and social development of Mozambique.

roles.title: Minister of Planning and Finance
quotes: From 1999-2004 she was Minister of Planning and Finance.
As Minister of Finance she focused on economic growth and reform and poverty reduction.

quotes: Chairperson of the Board of Directors of Barclays Bank Mozambique; She serves as Chairperson of the Board of Barclays Bank Mozambique S.A.
Former Prime Minister of Mozambique
Luísa Dias Diogo was Prime Minister of Mozambique from 2004 to 2010.
She began working in Mozambique's Finance Ministry in 1980
As Prime Minister Luísa Diogo was widely recognized for her achievements in the national reconstruction and economic and social development of Mozambique.
the Mozambican state honored her with the 2nd Degree Eduardo Mondlane Medal.
Luísa Diogo graduated with a BA in economics from Eduardo Mondlane University in Maputo
